Functions
00300_TEE_MaskCancellation
GP_050_Cancellation

Functions

 TestCase_GC00100_MonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00101_TEECtoMonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00105_MonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00110_MultiSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00111_MultiSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancelParallel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00115_MultiSession_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00116_MultiSession_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancelParallel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00120_MultiInstance_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00121_MultiInstance_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancelParallel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00125_MultiInstance_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancel ()
 
 TestCase_GC00126_MultiInstance_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancelParallel ()
 

Detailed Description

Description:
: Verify that TEE_MaskCancellation returns the correct value when called and that it has an effect on cancellation. 
           bool TEE_MaskCancellation(
                      void );

           CA setup:
              Same as TEE_GetCancellationFlag

           The TAs are the same as for TEE_GetCancellationFlag, but with additional commands:
              TEST_UNMASK_CANCELLATION: calls TEE_UnmaskCancellation() and sets the return value in the OUT parameter
              TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION:   calls TEE_MaskCancellation() and sets the return value in the OUT parameter

           CA tear down:
              Same as TEE_GetCancellationFlag

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00100_MonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that TEE_MaskCancellation() returns the correct return value.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEST_UNMASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains FALSE (previously unmasked)
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_050_Cancellation.00300_TEE_MaskCancellation.GC00100_MonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel
TestCase_GC00101_TEECtoMonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that TEE_MaskCancellation() returns the correct return value.
Test Steps:
Invoke the TA with TEE_MaskCancellation() Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEE_MaskCancellation() Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEE_UnmaskCancellation() Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEE_MaskCancellation() Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains FALSE (previously unmasked) Invoke the TA with TEE_MaskCancellation() Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked)
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_050_Cancellation.00300_TEE_MaskCancellation.GC00101_TEECtoMonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel
TestCase_GC00105_MonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that cancellation can be masked and unmasked.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-50ms The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA

Invoke the TA with TEST_UNMASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 1s The CA should measure execution time out 1s +/-100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA

Invoke the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains FALSE (previously unmasked) Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 2s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA

Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_050_Cancellation.00300_TEE_MaskCancellation.GC00105_MonoSession_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancel

GP_050_Cancellation.00300_TEE_MaskCancellation.GC00110_MultiSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancel
TestCase_GC00111_MultiSession_ReturnValueBehaviorNoCancelParallel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that TEE_MaskCancellation() returns the correct return value.
Test Steps:
Thread 1: DO Loop 20 times with rand delay of 2,4,6, or 8s: Open the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEST_UNMASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains FALSE (previously unmasked) Thread 2: Open the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) DO Loop 20 times with rand delay of 1,3,5, or 7s: Invoke the TA with TEST_UNMASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains FALSE (previously unmasked)
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
No
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:

TestCase_GC00116_MultiSession_ReturnValueBehaviorWithCancelParallel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that cancellation can be masked and unmasked.
Test Steps:
Thread 1: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-50ms The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Invoke the TA with TEST_UNMASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains TRUE (previously masked) Invoke the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 1s The CA should measure execution time out 1s +/-100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Invoke the TA with TEST_MASK_CANCELLATION Verify TEE_SUCCESS and that the OUT parameter contains FALSE (previously unmasked) Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 2s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Thread 2: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 15s The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The CA should measure execution time out 15s +/-50ms The OUT parameter should show FALSE, showing that cancellation did not happen
